Class Agent

java.lang.Object
Agent
public class Agent extends Object
Agents move on the grid and renforce/stop climate change based on Agent's role

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Agent()
    contructor that initialises an Agent they start to exist but aren't placed on a grid
    Agent(int x, int y)
    contructor that initialises an Agent on given coordinates

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    double
    distance(int x, int y)
    returns distace between the place where Agent is now and some other place in the grid
    void
    fixingClimateChange(long[][] carbon, double carbonAvrege, double carbonGoal, ArrayList<Agent> agent, Earth earth)
    this function represents what the agent can do during the year first we find where is the least amount of carbon then we either go to that place or to a random one (based on a given probability) if a current agent can do there it goes there: - if there is a coal mine or nothing, they close it and build a forest - if there is a forest they plant more trees each action generates an amount of co2 we can absorb to better the enviroment
    int
    getAgentX()
    returns coordinate x
    int
    getAgentY()
    returns coordinate y
    int
    getNumDeplacements()
    returns number of trips made
    void
    makingClimateChangeWorse(long[][] carbon, ArrayList<Agent> agent, Earth earth)
    this function represents what the agent can do during the year we generate a random place if it's close enough : we check if it's free and if it is: - if there is a coal mine, they make it generate more co2 - if probability is on our side and there is a forest, they cut out all the trees each action generates an amount of co2 that worsens out enviroment
    boolean
    seDeplacer(int xnew, int ynew, ArrayList<Agent> agent)
    returns true if there is an agent on given coordinates, else returns false, if there isn't an Agent on a given place, current Agent makes a trip to that given place

    • seDeplacer

      public boolean seDeplacer(int xnew, int ynew, ArrayList<Agent> agent)
      returns true if there is an agent on given coordinates, else returns false, if there isn't an Agent on a given place, current Agent makes a trip to that given place
      Parameters:
      xnew - first coordinate
      ynew - second coordinate
      agent - list of Agents
      Returns:
      true or false

    • fixingClimateChange

      public void fixingClimateChange(long[][] carbon, double carbonAvrege, double carbonGoal, ArrayList<Agent> agent, Earth earth)
      this function represents what the agent can do during the year first we find where is the least amount of carbon then we either go to that place or to a random one (based on a given probability) if a current agent can do there it goes there: - if there is a coal mine or nothing, they close it and build a forest - if there is a forest they plant more trees each action generates an amount of co2 we can absorb to better the enviroment
      Parameters:
      carbon - - array of carbon dioxide - tells us how much carbon there is in each place in a grid
      carbonAvrege - - an avreage of carbon dioxide in one place on a grid
      carbonGoal - - a desired amount of carbon dioxide in one place on a grid
      agent - - a list of one type of agents - good agents
      earth - - our enviroment which contains a grid

    • makingClimateChangeWorse

      public void makingClimateChangeWorse(long[][] carbon, ArrayList<Agent> agent, Earth earth)
      this function represents what the agent can do during the year we generate a random place if it's close enough : we check if it's free and if it is: - if there is a coal mine, they make it generate more co2 - if probability is on our side and there is a forest, they cut out all the trees each action generates an amount of co2 that worsens out enviroment
      Parameters:
      carbon - - array of carbon dioxide - tells us how much carbon there is in each place in a grid
      agent - - a list of one type of agents - bad agents
      earth - - our enviroment which contains a grid
